tool_description: If you are looking for a service who simply creates Shapefiles, then you’re in the right place.
name: ShapefileGenerator
title: ShapefileGenerator

api_list.name: WktToShapefile
api_list.description:
WktToShapefile – is a REST Api of POST method. 
It is dedicated to generate a shapefile taking data of WKT format as an input and generating (and downloading) the shapefile on your local machine. Below is a sample of the WKT input:
![](https://www.geoaxa.com/images/wktBody.PNG)

- **data**: like the name implies this field must hold an array of datas, where each object must have two properties: geometry and attributes.
           
- **geometry**: must contain the geometric coordinates in the WKT format. Based on the type of the geometric object, this field accepts three different types of values:
![](https://www.geoaxa.com/images/wktFormatData.PNG)

- ***attributes***: must contain a list of properties. Each object represent a property where “**propertyName**” is the name of the property and “**value**” holds the value of the specified property
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://shapefilegenerator.p.rapidapi.com/ShapefileFunction/wktToShapefile"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "shapefilegenerator.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://shapefilegenerator.p.rapidapi.com/ShapefileFunction/wktToShapefile"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "shapefilegenerator.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
